content.description: Twisted in Trovia climbs a classic, left-facing dihedral with good gear the whole way. Start with #0.5 or 0.75 Camalots, then the crack gradually widens to #4 size, which can be used to protect the move to the ledge. #4 and #5 cams protect the the moves to the anchor.
content.location: It is around the corner to the right from the top of the trailhead.

content.description: A bouldery start with difficult stemming past two bolts leads to an irregular but fun crack. The jagged nature of the crack can make some of the placements more difficult.
content.protection: 2 quickdraws, small size Z4s or TCUs for the lower half, and #0.3 to 1 Camalots for the upper half.
content.location: It is around the corner to the right from the top of the trailhead.

content.description: A tricky start with tricky gear and marginal rock quality leads to a nice but short, right-facing dihedral. Exit the dihedral on to a sloping ledge. The crack widens as you move up to clip the anchor. There's a fair amount of bat poop protecting the holds to clip the anchor, but it can be done clean.
content.protection: Camalots: #0.3 and other small cams for the start; #0.5 to 1 for the dihedral; and #2 - 4 for the top.
content.location: It is about 50 yards to the climber's right from the top of the trail.
